{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has no vision in her left eye and no pupillary response to light, which suggests a complete loss of function in the left optic nerve. When light is shone in the right eye, the right optic nerve should still be functioning and send signals to both pupils to constrict. Therefore, we would expect to see bilateral miosis, or constriction of both pupils.", "answer_choice": "A"}
